official-title.#text:
To authorize the President to award the Medal of Honor to Special Forces Command Sergeant Major
			 Ramon Rodriguez of the United States Army for acts of valor during the
			 Vietnam War.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Authorization for award of the Medal of Honor to Special Forces Sergeant Ramon Rodriguez for acts
			 of valor during the Vietnam War

text.#text:
At the age of 17, Ramon Rodriguez of Wilmington, California, began his military career when he
			 enlisted in the Army during his junior year at Banning High School.

While a Staff Sergeant in the Army, Ramon Rodriguez served in Vietnam for 32 months during the
			 Vietnam War.

quote.#text: fearless action while exposed to intense enemy fire

text.#text:
During a mission in 1967 in Phu Bai in Thua Thien Province, Staff Sergeant Rodriguez was wounded
			 while leading five soldiers to safety, for which he received a second
			 award of the Silver Star in recognition of his

In all, Staff Sergeant Rodriguez was awarded the Silver Star three times within a span of 34 days
			 for his courageous service during the Vietnam War.

Staff Sergeant Rodriguez was awarded three Bronze Stars with V and 2 Oak Leaf Cluster and five
			 Purple Hearts.

Command Sergeant Major Rodriguez received a total of 17 combat medals and awards for his service in
			 Vietnam in recognition of his heroism and acts of valor against hostile
			 enemy forces.

Staff Sergeant Rodriguez attended the United States Ranger School and graduated with distinguished
			 honors.

Staff Sergeant Rodriguez led the Special Forces scuba team at Ford Gulick, Canal Zone, Panama, and
			 directed several rescue missions.

In 1981, Staff Sergeant Rodriguez earned the rank of Command Sergeant Major at the United States
			 Sergeant Major Academy at Fort Bliss, Texas.
Command Sergeant Major Rodriguez was nominated for the Congressional Medal of Honor in 1982.

Command Sergeant Major Rodriguez completed two more assignments before officially retiring from the
			 Army in 1983.

On June 11, 2008, Command Sergeant Major Rodriguez was inducted as a member of the Ranger Hall of
			 Fame.

Command Sergeant Major Rodriguez is known to be one of the most decorated combat soldiers who
			 served in the Vietnam War.
